00024 Clip::Clip (Image image, const unsigned int &xOrigin, const unsigned int &yOrigin, const unsigned int &height, const unsigned int &width)
00025     : image_(image)
00026 {
00027     try
00028     {
00029         // Associate a frame with the image
00030         frame_ = new Pixels(image_);
00031     }
00032     catch (exception& e)
00033     {
00034         delete frame_;
00035         cout << e.what() << endl;
00036     }
00037     
00038     
00039     // Test the clip borders are inside the image
00040     if ( xOrigin >= image_.rows() or xOrigin < 0 )
00041         throw NessieException ("Clip::Clip: The X coordinate of clip's upper leftmost pixel is out of image borders");
00042     else
00043         xOrigin_ = xOrigin;
00044     
00045     if ( yOrigin >= image_.columns() or yOrigin < 0 )
00046         throw NessieException ("Clip::Clip: The Y coordinate of clip's upper leftmost pixel is out of image borders");
00047     else
00048         yOrigin_ = yOrigin;
00049     
00050         
00051     // Test the clip size is consistent with the image size
00052     if ( (xOrigin_ + height) > image_.rows() )
00053         height_ = image_.rows() - xOrigin_;
00054     else
00055         height_ = height;
00056     
00057     if ( (yOrigin_ + width) > image_.columns() )
00058         width_ = image_.columns() - yOrigin_;
00059     else
00060         width_ = width;
00061         
00062     
00063     try
00064     {
00065         // Initializes the pointer to the clip origin
00066         originPixel_ = frame_->get(xOrigin_, yOrigin_, width_, height_);
00067         
00068         // Initializes the image colorspace
00069         switch (image_.type())
00070         {
00071             case GrayscaleType:
00072             {
00073                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE;
00074                 break;
00075             }
00076             case TrueColorType:
00077             {
00078                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_RGB;
00079                 break;
00080             }
00081             case BilevelType:
00082             {
00083                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC;
00084                 break;
00085             }
00086             default:
00087             {
00088                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_UNDEFINED;
00089                 break;
00090             }
00091         }
00092     }
00093     catch (exception& e)
00094     {
00095         delete frame_;
00096         cout << e.what() << endl;
00097     }
00098 };

00268 
00280 void Clip::colorspace (const Colorspace &colorspace)
00281 {
00282     try
00283     {
00284         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00285         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00286         image_.modifyImage();
00287         
00288         // Convert the image colorspace to the new one
00289         switch (colorspace)
00290         {
00291             case COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE:
00292             {
00293                 image_.type( GrayscaleType );
00294                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE;
00295                 break;
00296             }
00297             case COLORSPACE_RGB:
00298             {
00299                 image_.type( TrueColorType );
00300                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_RGB;
00301                 break;
00302             }
00303             case COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC:
00304             {
00305                 image_.type( BilevelType );
00306                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC;
00307                 break;
00308             }
00309             default:
00310             {
00311                 // The colorspace remains the same
00312                 break;
00313             }
00314         }
00315         
00316         // Apply changes on the image
00317         frame_->sync();
00318     }
00319     catch (exception& e)
00320     {
00321         cout << e.what() << endl;
00322     }
00323 };

00333 {
00334     if ( colorspace_ == COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE )
00335         return true;
00336     else
00337         return false;

00383 Pixel Clip::getPixel (const unsigned int &x, const unsigned int &y) const
00384 {
00385     // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00386     if ( (x >= height_) or (x < 0) )
00387         throw NessieException ("Clip::getPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00388     
00389     if ( (y >= width_) or (y < 0) )
00390         throw NessieException ("Clip::getPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00391     
00392     // Get the pixel at desired location
00393     PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * width_) + y;
00394     
00395     // Build a new Pixel object with color information depending on image colorspace
00396     switch (colorspace_)
00397     {
00398         case COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE:
00399         {
00400             ColorGray grayLevel(*selectedPixel);
00401             return Pixel(x, y, grayLevel.shade());
00402             break;
00403         }
00404         case COLORSPACE_RGB:
00405         {
00406             ColorRGB rgbColor(*selectedPixel);
00407             return Pixel(x, y, rgbColor.red(), rgbColor.green(), rgbColor.blue());
00408             break;
00409         }
00410         case COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC:
00411         {
00412             ColorMono isForeground(*selectedPixel);
00413             return Pixel(x, y, isForeground.mono());
00414             break;
00415         }
00416         default:
00417         {
00418             throw NessieException ("Clip::getPixel: The pixel cannot be returned because the image colorspace is undefined");
00419             break;
00420         }
00421     }
00422 };

00437 void Clip::setPixel (const unsigned int &x, const unsigned int &y, const double &grayLevel)
00438 {
00439     if ( colorspace_ not_eq COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE )
00440         return;
00441     
00442     try
00443     {
00444         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00445         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00446         image_.modifyImage();
00447     
00448         // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00449         if ( x >= height_ or x < 0 )
00450             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00451 
00452         if ( y >= width_ or y < 0 )
00453             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00454 
00455         // Get the pixel at desired location
00456         PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * width_) + y;
00457 
00458         // Assign the desired value to the pixel
00459         *selectedPixel = ColorGray(grayLevel);
00460 
00461         // Apply changes on the image
00462         frame_->sync();
00463     }
00464     catch (exception& e)
00465     {
00466         cout << e.what() << endl;
00467     }
00468 };

00485 void Clip::setPixel (const unsigned int &x, const unsigned int &y, const double &red, const double &green, const double &blue)
00486 {
00487     if ( colorspace_ not_eq COLORSPACE_RGB )
00488         return;
00489     
00490     try
00491     {
00492         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00493         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00494         image_.modifyImage();
00495         
00496         // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00497         if ( x >= frame_->rows() or x < 0 )
00498             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00499 
00500         if ( y >= frame_->columns() or y < 0 )
00501             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00502 
00503         // Get the pixel at desired location
00504         PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * frame_->columns()) + y;
00505 
00506         // Assign the desired value to the pixel
00507         *selectedPixel = ColorRGB(red, green, blue);
00508 
00509         // Apply changes on the image
00510         frame_->sync();
00511     }
00512     catch (exception& e)
00513     {
00514         cout << e.what() << endl;
00515     }
00516 };

00531 {
00532     if ( colorspace_ not_eq COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC )
00533         return;

00536     {
00537         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00538         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00539         image_.modifyImage();
00540         
00541         // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00542         if ( x >= frame_->rows() or x < 0 )
00543             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00544

00546             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");

00549         PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * frame_->columns()) + y;

00570 void Clip::relocateClipOrigin ()
00571 {
00572     try
00573     {       
00574         // Relocate the pointer to the clip new origin
00575         originPixel_ = frame_->get(xOrigin_, yOrigin_, width_, height_);
00576     }
00577     catch (exception& e)
00578     {
00579         cout << e.what() << endl;
00580     }

00583 
00591 void Clip::adjustClipSize ()
00592 {
00593     if ( (yOrigin_ + width_) > image_.columns() )
00594         width_ = image_.columns() - yOrigin_;
00595     
00596     if ( (xOrigin_ + height_) > image_.rows() )
00597         height_ = image_.rows() - xOrigin_;
00598 };
